result.execSummary:
The defendant Darla A George was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).
  • Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 2 years bifurcated sentence. **AMENDED 4/18/18 PER JUDGE'S DECISION TO GIVE THE DEFT 16 DAYS CREDIT ON COUNT 1**
Consecutive to: Ct. 1 in 14CF1771 (CORRECTED 11-01-2018)

superMiscConds.notes: If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances, including Zanax and Adderral, except for those prescribed by treating health care provider.  Submit to random testing as required by agent.  Cooperate with AODA assessment and follow through with treatment, counseling and program recommendations.  Absolute sobriety is required.

Provide DNA sample as required by law and pay assessed surcharge.  Pay costs of supervision and court oblilgations.  Cooperate with counseling, treatment and programs determined appropriate, including anger management.  Follow through with recommendations.  Comply with mental health assessment and follow through with recommendations.  Attend parenting classes.  Attend 5 self-help meetings per week and provide signed verification of attendance to agent.  Not to own, possess or use any body armor.  Firearm prohibition warning given.  Voting prohibited until sentence has been completed and civil rights are restored.

If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  It is the court's intention that the Department of Corrections can take 50% from all money received for the benefit of the inmate while he is incarcerated to be applied to restitution owing to the victim.

supervisions.notes:
Length of confinement and length of extended supervision for a total length of 6 years bifurcated sentence. **AMENDED 4/18/18 PER JUDGE'S DECISION TO GIVE THE DEFT 150 DAYS CREDIT ON COUNT 3**    

**CORRECTED 11-01-2018:  CFTS = 166 days.   Defendant's sentence was ordered concurrent and therefore defendant should have full credit on Cts. 3 and 17.**

**2ND CORRECTION 11-01-2018:  CFTS = 150 days (this amount does include the full credit).

**AMENDED 06-18-2019:   Defendant's credit for time served is amended to 153 DAYS (which includes custody dates of 10-30-2015 to 11-03-2015, 11-30-2015 to 12-15-2015, and 02-12-2016 to 06-23-2016) **
Concurrent with: with Count 1 and 14CF1771 (CORRECTED 10-31-2017)

**2ND CORRECTION 11-01-2018:  CFTS = 150 days (this amount does include all defendant's credit).

**AMENDED 06-18-2019:   Defendant's credit for time served is amended to 153 DAYS (which includes custody dates of 10-30-2015 to 11-03-2015, 11-30-2015 to 12-15-2015, and 02-12-2016 to 06-23-2016) **
